subject: Home Again
event:
I'm glad so many of you enjoyed my April's Fool post.  Thanks for the laughs.

I'm back home again from the conventions in Blacksburg, Virginia and Madison, Wisconsin, and settling in for the big push.  The cons were both great fun, though travel was, as usual, stressful and unpleasant.  More and more, I am finding that while I love visiting distant cities and exotic climes, I hate the process of getting there.  Would that I could teleport.

Or drive.  I still love driving.  Give me my RX-7, an open road, some good tunes on my tape deck, and the Babe in the Box to tell me where to go, and I'm a happy traveller.  Put me at an airport and my blood pressure starts to build at once.

Ah, well.

Anyway, I'm back now, and not going anywhere until late June, when I will be taking off on my long-anticipated trip to Ireland, Portugal, and Spain.  It's part vacation, part speaking engagement, and part promotional tour.  If you live in or near any of those three places, watch the Appearances page on my website for details of when and when I'll be.  We'll be adding dates as the events are confirmed.

Of course, I need to finish A DANCE WITH DRAGONS before I leave, or else my publishers will hunt me down and kill me.  So that's pretty much all I'll be doing between now and then.  And if I don't finish, maybe I'll just stay in Ireland, Portugal, or Spain, where no one will ever be able to find me.

Actually it's not true that DANCE is all that I'll be doing.  I'll also be editing the next Wild Cards books, SUICIDE KINGS, co-editing WARRIORS and SONGS OF THE DYING EARTH with Gardner Dozois, finishing the third Dunk & Egg novella, which is oh-so-close, and of course watching the NFL draft.  Without me glued to the television, how will the Giants and the Jets know who to pick?  But never mind...

I don't know how much I will be posting here, or updating my website in general, however.  The News page is woefully out of date, I know, and the pictures of babies, puppies, and cute kittens for the fan page are piling up... but for what it's worth, when my webpage isn't getting update, that's usually a sign that I'm lost in my writing, with no energy left at the end of the day for much else.  So that's good.

Oh, and then there's Center Stage.  More on that in a moment.

comments.article: You were in Blacksburg and I didn't know it?  How inconvenient.  I guess I should keep up these things more.

comments.upictitle: A Work In Progress: Sherlock reading
comments.article: Me too! I was so mad when I found out he was just fifteen minutes out of my way. I totally would have hunted him down. Sadness. :(

or else my publishers will hunt me down and kill me.

Hehe that's pretty funny. You know your fans are going to forgive just about any amount of time that it will take you to write it.

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: Benevolent sense of life
comments.article:
>maybe I'll just stay in Ireland, Portugal, or Spain, where no one will ever be >able to find me.

One foot follows the other, and then one stabs the truant author with righteous vengeance. Just so.

Of course, I need to finish A DANCE WITH DRAGONS before I leave, or else my publishers will hunt me down and kill me.

I would actually bet that your readers would beat your publishers to the punch, as it were.

I've found a lovely little cottage down in a dingley dell where no one will find us. Grass grows in the middle of the lane that leads to the dirt track that leads to the deer path that leads to......

the way I figure, most of our stuff is still packed up anyway...
comments.subject: don't worry

comments.upictitle: Stop drooling at my pic!!!!: Author pose
comments.article:
I am happy to wait for A Dance With Dragons, after all there is still going to be a wait until the sixth and seventh book.

I also never noticed that your post was an April fool prank, probably because it was not before 12 ( I think it is a UK thing). I just thought you were being silly for silly's sake. Like valentines day, I don't need a special day to be silly.

Oh and not sure if you will be interested but 'Charlie Jade', a south african/canadian scifi series, will be airing on scifi channel at the end of May in the US. I have watched the first five episodes and has potential, also got quite a few good reviews.

comments.upictitle: J.A.C.K. Inc.  Super Secret Ninja Force: chiburi
comments.article: Welcome back.  Ireland, Portugal, and Spain, wow, that sounds wonderful.  I hear Ireland has no extradition treaty with the US so they can't ship you back.  :P

The Irish government was allowing the 'extraordinary rendition' of terrorist suspects captured in Iraq and Afghanistan back to the States via Shannon Airport, so little things like legality and human rights aren't a barrier here.

Of course, whilst Bantam's powers are vast and subtle, I think it unlikely they could get GRRM classified as a dangerous terrorist ;) Unless Dubya turns out to a SoIaF fan: "I learned all about ruling from Cersei Lannister."
As a family, we unanimously agreed to forgo air travel last vacation.  It was much more fun to squeeze five adults and two weeks luggage into a car and drive for ten hours.  Really, it was.

comments.upictitle: Madam Lulzy the Great: Deedlit Relaxing
comments.article: Multitasking has its drawbacks. :(

Huh, I guess that means you expect to have DANCE done in couple months, be still, oh beating heart. :)

Also, this is totally not the place for it or anything, I know that, but I just finished Terry Goodkind's books, and midly enjoyed them. Then I went and read some interviwes with that stupid close-minded bastard and I now have a large, burning ember of hatred lodged deep down in my cockles. I would love to hear what you think of him, but I'll keep dreaming.

I believe the GRRM has said that he doesn't comment on other authors (apart from to say how awesome they are).

Happily others are not so constrained. If you go to the forum at asoiaf.westeros.org under the 'Literature' section you will find the latest discussion, debate and in-depth analysis of Mr. Goodkind's work and his Important Human Themes, such as how chickens are evil and why fire is bad.

Of course, I need to finish A DANCE WITH DRAGONS before I leave, or else my publishers will hunt me down and kill me. So that's pretty much all I'll be doing between now and then. And if I don't finish, maybe I'll just stay in Ireland, Portugal, or Spain, where no one will ever be able to find me.

I don't think its the publishers you need to worry about the most. It's some of the more, ah, impatient and tenacious fans.

oh! I'm in Ireland! If you're in Cork, and fancy meeting up for a drink (or I know a reasonably decent pizza place), let me know! I'm emailable at cemurphyauthor@gmail.com, if you like. :)

-Catie

Of course, I need to finish A DANCE WITH DRAGONS before I leave, or else my publishers will hunt me down and kill me.


Or your adoring fans will hunt you down and whine at you!

Oh wait...we already do that. Carry on, then!

Oooooh you are touring Europe!
You should come visit Greece, you have a huge fanbase here as well!!! Unfortunately we are not organized though, so I really can't tell who would make the invite:S
Also, worry more about your publishers than us, there's a saying in Greece: "dogs that bark loud don't bite". That is about as perfect as a description for your fans, than anything. We just whine a lot, but other than that, nothing big. Besides, should we undertake violent acts, you would never complete the story, so we would still lose in the end.

Haha, April´s Fool joke had me eyeballing for a minute (Here in Spain, Fool´s Day is actually Innocents Day and it´s celebrated on Dec 28th)!

^o^ I can´t wait for you to be in Spain! I´ll be checking the site to know where you´ll go. Perchance Madrid...?

Also, if you have the publishers on your tracks, we´ll be happy to hide you somewhere in the mountains in the South, you know, where the French lost the war :P

and the 'appearances' page, when he has detailed information, he'll post it there.

Generally, he's going to Lisbon around the 29th of June, then on to Madrid the 7th of July, Semana Negra in Gijon July 11 - 16, and Barcelona from the 16th to at least the 20th of July. He may add more cities to the tour, depending on many variables, the most important one being completion of DANCE. But he has to be back no later than the end of July, since the Worldcon in Denver is the first week of August.

Check his Spanish publishers and specialty SF/F stores as well, they may have up more information on actual times and locations of his public appearances, especially as the trip draws near. I know he's doing something at a library on the 17th in Barcelona, but there's many details to fill in and schedule.

Looking forward to meeting you and many more Spanish fans on this trip.
comments.subject: check George's web site

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: cheese
comments.article:
Glad you've arrived home safely. I hear Ireland is full of nefarious, heavily-armed ne'er-do-wells. They make good bodyguards, though. (you hear that, KoR?)

Good luck with the writing/editing. We'll hoist a bonafied (heh) NYC slice (or three) in your name on Friday after ComiCon.
Hmmm
Good news, George and good luck for the Big Push!

I can't help but wonder how on earth JRRT would have managed if he had had to contend with the intarnets baying crowds as well. Probably done a Lord Lucan on us.

you're doing extremely well under pressure I have to say :)
Oh I think you can rule out Ireland as a safe haven ;-)

Wait, let me get this straight: You write killer fiction /and/ you're a fan of RX-7s?

Someday, sir, I'm going to buy you a drink. And, if I may be so bold as to inquire: What kind of '7 do you drive?

It is nice that you are wanting to do all these things but I feel that at the rate in which you write you shall pass on before the Ice and Fire series is even close to being finished and then all of the readers will have wasted time reading the books for nothing.

I say wasted time because even though we have read 4 books you have not finished anything which to scale it down would be like someone buying a novel and reading the first half the book and then finding out the second half is filled with blank pages.

Please, finish the series or at the very least write down enough ideas so that someone can finish it after you have gone.

And all this time I thought you were hard at work :D Now get to work! In all seriousness I hope it's weeks before we get another update cause we know that means you're hard at work ;) Okay I can't escape this broken record theme, sorry George I know you're probably working harder than I am right now detailing concrete and steel. I'm glad to hear all is well and I'll definitely have to check those comics out on my next trip to my friendly local comics shop!

Hi George

Will you be doing any signings in Ireland? Given your interest in Miniatures of Knights etc, One thing you should do while you are here is to visit the Prince August Miniatures Factory in Kilnamartra, which is near Macroom in County Cork. They make Miniatures and casting kits for a wide range of Military eras including the Medieval. Their website is http://www.princeaugust.ie/
comments.subject: re Trip to Ireland

comments.article:
I love your taste in cars George - didnt know you had an RX7!!? :) Atleast we sort of have one thing in common as i love jumping into my RX8 for long drives - hate air travel agghh..

Thanks for the update and hopefully you can get Dance done and dusted and then enjoy your holiday!

I hope to see you when you come to Ireland.  I'm looking forward to finding out where you will be visiting.  I hope that you have a good time and enjoy some craic.  Good luck with all of your projects.
comments.subject: Home again ... until late June
